page.title: 08OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH
page.content: With the decline of sheep farming and the emphasis on forestry,employement on farms has decreased.Mechanised farming attracts the young ,is now a skilled job , and is eagerly sought. Less popular with the young is shepherding, although again mechanised transport eliminates weary miles of trudging on foot over rough hill land and some young lads still feel the call of sheep and become dedicated shepherds and eventually flockmasters. Haulage is necessary for both farming and forestry , and the mechanically minded find great satisfaction doing this The only disadvantage , as one young haulier put it is distance from town."I intend to marry soon. My fiancee works in town fifteen miles away .Fifteen miles of snow and a 9am deadline to meet!".But we wont live in town!".
